definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: Stability of an Iterative Dual-Doppler Wind Synthesis in Cartesian Coordinates.
sentences.chinese: 笛卡爾座標系中迭代雙多普勒風合成的穩定性。

sentences.english: Descartes coordinate modeling of multibody systems dynamics is adopted in the thesis.
sentences.chinese: 採用多體動力學笛卡爾座標建模形式。

sentences.english: I mean Descartes theory is actually rather dubiously coherent, if you think about it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你仔細思考下，笛卡爾的理論還是值得懷疑的。

sentences.english: Galileo and Descartes replaced that with the idea of inertia.
sentences.chinese: 伽利略和笛卡爾用慣性的概念將其取代。

sentences.english: This is the kind of perplexing thought Descartes forces us to confront.
sentences.chinese: 這正是笛卡爾迫使我們面對的那種令人費解的想法。

sentences.english: I could do the same thing, I could build polar point.
sentences.chinese: 很多笛卡爾點，我可以做一些同樣的操作。

sentences.english: The connecting lines are arcs, and the points within the Cartesian coordinate system are nodes.
sentences.chinese: 連接線稱爲弧，笛卡爾座標系統中的點稱爲節點。

sentences.english: Descartes said, I thought, so I exist.
Its four possible inputs correspond to four points on a Cartesian graph.
sentences.chinese: 它的四種可能輸入對應於笛卡爾圖的四個點。

sentences.english: And while he spent time in Europe, he met Galileo and Rene Descartes.
sentences.chinese: 在歐洲時，他遇到了伽利略和笛卡爾。

sentences.english: Remember Descartes thought that the essence of matter is extension.
sentences.chinese: 還記得笛卡爾認爲物質的核心是在於延展麼。

sentences.english: In other words, Descartes is still thinking along these same lines.
sentences.chinese: 換句換說，笛卡爾也在思考同樣的問題。
但是笛卡爾形式發生了什麼呢？

sentences.english: p But it now says that in any, in no matter what kind of form I made it from, I can get out that kind of information.
sentences.chinese: 例如我定義了，記得這裏吧，是一個笛卡爾卡。

sentences.english: A case can be made out, as it also can with Descartes, for regarding him as an accomplished experimentalist.
sentences.chinese: 像笛卡爾一樣，可以認爲他是一種成功的實驗家。

sentences.english: This forms part of the introduction by Descartes of his own way to science.
sentences.chinese: 笛卡爾以科學作爲真理之道，就這樣形成。

definition: no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality

pinyin: duo1 yuan2 wen2 hua4 zhu3 yi4

definition: (idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
Jian Zoupianfeng, pseudonym of prolific modern novelist
the sword moves with side stroke (modern idiom)/fig. unexpected winning move/unconventional gambit
